com.shadowolf.announce
Class Announce

java.lang.Object
  com.shadowolf.announce.Announce

public final class Announce
extends java.lang.Object

Simple class that encapsulates and validates all of the data for a valid announce.

Announce

public Announce(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
         throws AnnounceException
Constructor, takes an HttpServletRequest instance and parses the required fields and validates them

Parameters:
request - the HttpServletRequest instance to parse
Throws:
AnnounceException - thrown if any validation fails.
Method Detail

getEvent

public TrackerRequest.Event getEvent()
Get the event specified for this announce.

Returns:
the event
See Also:
TrackerRequest.Event

getUploaded

public long getUploaded()
Get the uploaded amount for this announce, in bytes. Note that the uploaded amount is total for the entire session, not simply since the last announce.

Returns:
the uploaded amount.

getDownloaded

public long getDownloaded()
Get the downloaded amount for this announce, in bytes. Note that the downloaded amount is total for the entire session, not simply since the last announce.

Returns:
the downloaded amount.

getLeft

public long getLeft()
Get the left amount for this announce, in bytes. The left amount is sent on every announce as a total sum of what isn't downloaded on the torrent. A value greater than 0 can indicate either a leecher or a partial seeder.

Returns:
the left amount.

getNumwant

public int getNumwant()
Get the numwant amount for this announce. The numwant is sent, optionally, to tell the tracker how many peers to send back. If not set, defaults to 200.

Returns:
the amount of peers requested.

getInfoHash

public java.lang.String getInfoHash()
Get the info_hash for this torrent. According to the protocol, info_hashes are 20-byte sha1 hashes that are sent "raw," for simplification of debugging and value comparisons, this is translated to a 40-character hexadecimal string.

Returns:
the hex-encoded info_hash string

getPeerId

public java.lang.String getPeerId()
Get the peer_id for this torrent. The peer_id is a partially-unique field sent with each announce. The first few characters are usually a client identifier, followed by a random string used to uniquely identify this tracker session. The bytes are usually not characters specified by a character set and if they are, it is entirely random. As such, this string gets interpreted using the character set (see getEncoding()) associated with this announce.

Returns:
the peer_id
See Also:
Bep 0020 - the specification for peer_id conventions

getEncoding

public java.lang.String getEncoding()
Get the encoding for this announce. Set by the HTTP request or defaults to ISO-8859-1.

Returns:
the character encoding.

getPort

public java.lang.String getPort()
Get the port that the client is listening on, as specified in the announce.

Returns:
the port the client is listening on.

getIP

public java.lang.String getIP()
Get the IP the client is running on. The "IP" GET parameter is ignored and this is set to the address the announce originated from. This is by design and is not a bug.

Returns:
the client's IP

getPasskey

public java.lang.String getPasskey()
Get the passkey associated with this announce.

Returns:
the client's passkey

setUploaded

public void setUploaded(long uploaded)
Sets the upload to the specified amount. The original amount is overwritten, not added. THIS SHOULD BE USED WITH CAUTION.

Parameters:
uploaded - the new amount of upload

setDownloaded

public void setDownloaded(long downloaded)
Sets the download to the specified amount. The original amount is overwritten, not added. THIS SHOULD BE USED WITH CAUTION.

Parameters:
downloaded - the new amount of download
